identificationModule.briefTitle: 64Cu-SAR-bisPSMA and 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA for Identification and Treatment of PSMA-expressing Metastatic Castrate Resistant Prostate Cancer (SECuRE)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase I/IIa Theranostic Study of 64Cu-SAR-bisPSMA and 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA for Identification and Treatment of PSMA-expressing Metastatic Castrate Resistant Prostate Cancer

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The aim of this study is to determine the safety and efficacy of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA in participants with PSMA-expressing metastatic castrate resistant prostate cancer.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: This study is to be conducted in 3 phases, a dosimetry phase, a dose escalation phase and a cohort expansion phase.

armGroups.label: 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA
armGroups.description:
In the dosimetry phase patients will receive a single 200 MBq administration of 64Cu-SAR-bisPSMA.

In the dose escalation phase patients will receive up to 2 administrations of 200 MBq of 64Cu-SAR-bisPSMA.

In the cohort expansion phase patients will receive up to 3 administrations of 200 MBq of 64Cu-SAR-bisPSMA.

In the dose escalation phase patients will receive up to 2 administrations of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA (dose will be determined based on cohort allocation).

In the cohort expansion phase patients will receive 2 administrations of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA at the recommended dose level determined through dose escalation.

primaryOutcomes.description: Biodistribution will be calculated by utilizing the PET/CT scans.
Dosimetry will be calculated by utilizing the PET/CT scans.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Modelling of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA dosimetry utilizing the 64Cu-SAR-bisPSMA PET/CT scans
primaryOutcomes.description: Dosimetry will be calculated by utilizing the PET/CT scans.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) or Maximum Feasible Dose of a single dose of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA
primaryOutcomes.description: MDT as determined by cohort observations of dose limiting toxicities (DLT)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Recommended dose of two doses of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA
primaryOutcomes.description: Recommended dose as determined by cohort observations of DLTs

primaryOutcomes.measure: Efficacy of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA in terms of Prostate specific Antigen (PSA) response
primaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of participants with ≥50% decline in PSA

primaryOutcomes.measure: Efficacy of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA in terms of radiographic response
primaryOutcomes.description: Efficacy will be assessed via the overall response rate according to RECIST V1.1 for soft tissue disease and according PCWG3 for bone lesions

primaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events [Safety and Tolerability]
primaryOutcomes.description: Adverse Events will be as assessed by CTCAE version 5.00

primaryOutcomes.measure: Safety and tolerability of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA: Number of Participants With Changes from baseline in Vital Signs
primaryOutcomes.description: Change from baseline in vital signs

primaryOutcomes.measure: Safety and tolerability of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA: Number of Participants With Changes from baseline in electrocardiogram (ECG) parameters
primaryOutcomes.description: Change from baseline in ECG parameters

primaryOutcomes.measure: Safety and tolerability of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA: Number of Participants With Changes from baseline in laboratory results
primaryOutcomes.description: Change from baseline in laboratory results

primaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of 64Cu-SAR-bisPSMA Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events [Safety and Tolerability]
primaryOutcomes.description: Adverse Events will be as assessed by CTCAE version 5.00

locations.facility: Washington University School of Medicine at Barnes-Jewish Hospital
Weill Cornell Medicine at New York-Presbyterian
